This publication is issued in conjunction with the exhibition ATAndalus: The Art of Islamic Spain, held at the Alhambra, Granada (March 18-June 7,1992), and The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York (July l-September 27,1992). The exhibition was organized by The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, and the Patronato de la Alhambra y Generalife, under the joint patronage of the Junta de Andalucia, the Ministerio de Cuitura, and the Ayuntamiento de Granada; it was sponsored by Banco Bilbao Vizcaya. Transportation assistance has been provided by Iberia Airlines of Spain. Additional support for the exhibition in New York has been provided by the National Endowment for the Humanities, a federal agency, and by an indemnity from the Federal Council on the Arts and the Humanities.
